item.title: Optimizing the ground of a Robin Laplacian: asymptotic behavior
item.description: arXiv:2408.11636v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this note we consider achieving the largest principle eigenvalue of a Robin Laplacian on a bounded domain $\Omega$ by optimizing the Robin parameter function under an integral constraint. The main novelty of our approach lies in establishing a close relation between the problem under consideration and the asymptotic behavior of the Dirichlet heat content of $\Omega$. By using this relation we deduce a two-term asymptotic expansion of the principle eigenvalue and discuss several applications.
item.dc:creator: Pavel Exner, Hynek Kovarik

item.title: Spectral Metric and Einstein Functionals for Hodge-Dirac operator
item.description: arXiv:2307.14877v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We examine the metric and Einstein bilinear functionals of differential forms introduced in Adv.Math.,Vol.427,(2023)1091286, for Hodge-Dirac operator $d+\delta$ on an oriented even-dimensional Riemannian manifold. We show that they reproduce these functionals for the canonical Dirac operator on a spin manifold up to a numerical factor. Furthermore, we demonstrate that the associated spectral triple is spectrally closed, which implies that it is torsion-free.
item.dc:creator: Ludwik D\k{a}browski, Pawe{\l} Zalecki, Andrzej Sitarz

item.title: Spectral Torsion
item.description: arXiv:2308.01644v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We introduce a trilinear functional of differential one-forms for a finitely summable regular spectral triple with a noncommutative residue. We demonstrate that for a canonical spectral triple over a closed spin manifold it recovers the torsion of the linear connection. We examine several spectral triples, including Hodge-de\,Rham, Einstein-Yang-Mills, almost-commutative two-sheeted space, conformally rescaled noncommutative tori, and quantum $SU(2)$ group, showing that the third one has a nonvanishing torsion if nontrivially coupled.
item.dc:creator: Ludwik D\k{a}browski, Andrzej Sitarz, Pawe{\l} Zalecki

item.title: Wave packet decomposition for Schrodinger evolution with rough potential and generic value of parameter
item.description: arXiv:2408.03470v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We develop the wave packet decomposition to study the Schrodinger evolution with rough potential. As an application, we obtain the improved bound on the wave propagation for the generic value of a parameter.
item.dc:creator: Sergey A. Denisov
